Examples.name: Forward Sampling - Stochastic Wave Loads on a Frame Structure - JONSWAP Spectra
Examples.description: Generate a stochastic wave loading on a simple structure using a stochastic wave spectra in a local UQ workflow. The structure is a simple 1-story OpenSees structure. Engineering Demand Parameters are PFA, RMSA, PFD, and PID. The wave loading is generated using a stochastic wave spectra (JONSWAP). The wave loading is applied to the floors as lateral forces.

Examples.name: Sensitivity Analysis - Stochastic Wave Loading on a Frame Structure - JONSWAP Spectra
Examples.description: Generate a Gaussian Process (GP) surrogate model for stochastic wave loading on a simple frame structure using a stochastic wave spectra in a local UQ workflow. The structure is a simple 1-story OpenSees frame structure. Engineering Demand Parameters are PFA, RMSA, PFD, and PID. The wave loading is generated using a stochastic wave spectra (JONSWAP). The wave loading is applied to the floors as lateral forces.

Examples.name: Reliability Analysis - Stochastic Wave Loading on a Frame Structure - JONSWAP Spectra
Examples.description: Generate a Gaussian Process (GP) surrogate model for stochastic wave loading on a simple frame structure using a stochastic wave spectra in a local UQ workflow. The structure is a simple 1-story OpenSees frame structure. Engineering Demand Parameters are PFA, RMSA, PFD, and PID. The wave loading is generated using a stochastic wave spectra (JONSWAP). The wave loading is applied to the floors as lateral forces.

Examples.name: Surrogate Model - Stochastic Wave Loading on a Frame Structure - JONSWAP Spectra
Examples.description: Generate a Gaussian Process (GP) surrogate model for stochastic wave loading on a simple frame structure using a stochastic wave spectra in a local UQ workflow. The structure is a simple 1-story OpenSees frame structure. Engineering Demand Parameters are PFA, RMSA, PFD, and PID. The wave loading is generated using a stochastic wave spectra (JONSWAP). The wave loading is applied to the floors as lateral forces.

Examples.name: Real-Time Event - Simple Piston Generated Wave - Taichi Lang
Examples.description: Forward sample a 2D wave maker piston's generated wave implemented in the high-performance Taichi Lang.

Examples.name: Near-Real Time Wave-Solver - Seaside, OR Experimental Replication - CelerisAi
Examples.description: Forward sample a near-real time CelerisAi wave simulator. Replicates experiments on Seaside, Oregon, by Cox et al. 2008. Performed in Oregon State University's Directional Wave Basin.

Examples.name: Near-Real Time Wave-Solver - Oregon State University's Large Wave Flume - CelerisAi
Examples.description: Forward sample a near-real time CelerisAi wave simulator. Replicates experiments in Oregon State University's Large Wave Flume, by Winter 2019 and Mascarenas 2022.

Examples.name: Near-Real Time Wave-Solver - Tsunami Vulnerability of a School in Loiza, Puerto Rico - CelerisAi
Examples.description: Forward sample a near-real time CelerisAi wave simulator. Studies the tsunami vulnerability of a school in Loiza, Puerto Rico, due to local bathymetry.

Examples.name: Digital Flume (Oregon State Univ. LWF) - Debris Impacts in a Tsunami-Like Wave - ClaymoreUW MPM
Examples.description: This example takes a brief look at uncertainty quantification in a three story shear frame subjected to earthquake loading.

Examples.name: Digital Flume (Waseda Univ. TWB) - Debris Motion and Loads in a Scaled Port Setting - ClaymoreUW MPM
Examples.description: Simulating experiments by Nils Goseberg et al. (2016) regarding debris motion through varied arrays of square column obstacles. Debris represent 1:40 Froude scaled shipping containers in a port setting. An elongated solitary wave is generated by the vacuum chamber of Waseda University's Tsunami Wave Basin. Debris spreading angle, longtiudinal displacement, and impact loads on obstacles are measured.

Examples.name: Digital Flume (Oregon State Univ. LWF) - Multi-Story Structure Wave Loading - FOAMySees
Examples.description: This example takes a brief look at uncertainty quantification in a three story shear frame subjected to earthquake loading.

Examples.name: Digital Flume (Univ. Washington WASIRF) - Cylinder Half-Submerged in Crossflow - FOAMySees
Examples.description: This example takes a brief look at uncertainty quantification in a three story shear frame subjected to earthquake loading.
